intro: Flourensia hispida, commonly known as the rough flourensia, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features silver-gray foliage with fine, bristly hairs that give it a distinctive, rugged appearance. Its yellow flowers bloom in clusters, often attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Flourensia hispida is typically found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
